issue.title: intl linking error in OS X Yosemite when manually building

content.raw:
I have seen this error before. It is related to `gettext`, which is a dependency of `gts`. `gettext` is "keg-only", which means that it is not sym-linked to /usr/local. It is handled properly for brew installs, but manual source builds will not be able to find it.

Two options:

* add the following to your bashrc:
~~~
export LIBRARY_PATH=${LIBRARY_PATH}:/usr/local/opt/gettext/lib
~~~

* uninstall `gts`
content.html:
I have seen this error before. It is related to gettext, which is a dependency of gts. gettext is "keg-only", which means that it is not sym-linked to /usr/local. It is handled properly for brew installs, but manual source builds will not be able to find it.

Two options:

  • add the following to your bashrc:
export LIBRARY_PATH=${LIBRARY_PATH}:/usr/local/opt/gettext/lib
  • uninstall gts
